newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan repo rate rise boosts other rates.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan repo rate rise boosts other rates.

text.p: Pakistani interbank call and overnight rates shot to 20 percent on Tuesday after the State (central) Bank of Pakistan raised its repurchase discount rate to 20 percent a year from 17 percent, dealers said.

"It is expected that the overall interest rate structure of the market would be raised after this move," a dealer at KASB & Co said, adding that rates of return on Federal Investment Bonds, Short-term Federal Bonds and T-bills would also rise.

He said the repo rate rise had been widely expected given the persistent shortage of funds in the interbank market, where banks had been borrowing an average of four to six billion rupees daily from the central bank's discount window at 17 percent. -- Karachi newsroom 9221-5685192
